resources.string:
This app demonstrate accuracy of iBeacons inside of a room and tries to generate heat map using them. Because of iBeacon's proximity error, we have to use some approximation method to increase the precision of our position.

 In this demo you can set size of a room and choose one of few approximation methods.

Tested on iBKS105 from accent-systems
 transmit interval: 0.1sec
TX power +4dBm

accuration method originally from 
https://github.com/alt236/Bluetooth-LE-Library---Android

You will need at least 3 iBeacons for this demo(4 maximum).\n First step is to assign colors to your iBeacons. You don\'t have to set UUID, major or minor values. Bluetooth address is used as unique identifier of iBeacons.
Set size of a room and select one of the approximation methods to get more precise values.
Place your iBeacon in the middle of the walls as picture above If you place the iBeacons wrong, you can get misleading results.\nDrag and drop to change location of iBeacons on canvas.
Launch \'generate heat map\' and watch your position in time. You should see a heatmap of your moves.
To generate iBeacons please cofigure at least 3 different iBeacons
Sorry, your device does not support Bluetooth LE
For this demo you\'ll need to set 4 iBeacons

string-array.item: Averaged over last two minimum values of the last 2 seconds.
Averaged over last two minimum values of the last 15 values. Maximum change from the previous position is limited to 0.1 meter.

This demo has different approach. It stores all iBeacons accuracies from 10 seconds. Then it compares every accuracies from iBeacon in 1 second interval and draw it on display. This heat map generation can take few minues, so be patient.
